content.description: Steep climbing on good holds. Fun! This is labeled as a 10c in the guidebook but it felt comparable to itâ€™s neighbor which is a 10b.
content.protection: 9 bolts plus anchor (bolts with rap rings)
content.location: Follows the black water streak just to the left of Technicolor Cabbage.

content.description: The least powerful route of the trio of steep shorties on the right side of the frontera... Immediately to the right of Cobblestone Cowboy. Fun movement from bottom to top!
Short power route on roadside overhang right of Captain Bullet... 4 bolts of fury to a easy roof pull. Freshly de-cobwebbed! Enjoy!
A fun beginner route on the right wall of the small canyon.
Climb jug cobbles and matrix pockets, cross a few cobble pods, and end with a fun and tricky corner to arete combo.
content.location:
Just left of the highly trafficked

Gunsmoke

.

content.description: Start in the corner formed by a large flake system. At the second bolt move right onto the face, move through the horizontal seam, then surmount slightly overhanging rock above.
content.protection: Bolts to chains with permanent carabiners
content.location: located 20 feet down canyon from the forest service sign on a shield of varnished rock that faces up-canyon.

content.description: This is a pretty cool route and its cleaning up quite nicely.   There is still some loose stuff in the beginning and here and there throughout.   Very cool thoughtful climbing with some sections that are certainly not juggy.    Cool finish too, you kinda perch on these protruding large cobbles to clip the chains.
content.location: The next to last route on the right wall as you head into the tight canyon.

content.description: Climb through four bolts of fun cobbles to gain a ledge and a killer shakeout. Six more bolts of very continuous climbing to a grand finale. Not as hard as the route to the left or the two to the right, but my favorite of the routes on this steep roof. If you're looking for a sweet 12c, this is one of the better ones just from it's continuity alone. This gets sun throughout the day since it's south facing, but a little shade late in the day.
content.location: Currently, this is the third route from the left on the huge roof and the second route to left of Captain Bullet. There are anchors for two more routes to the right of the leftmost route, so in the future it might be the 5th route from the left. This thing is so steep you can stick clip most of the quickdraws standing on the bumper of your car.

content.description: Start left of a corner formed by a large flake system. Climb up through the bottom of a shallow couloir to the first bolt, then move straight up the vertical face above.At the second bolt move right onto the face, move through the horizontal seam, then surmount slightly overhanging rock above.
content.protection: Bolts to chains with fixed carabiners
content.location: Located 20 felt down canyon from the forest service sign on a shield of varnished rock that faces up canyon.

content.description: Good Rock with big holds.  Optional stemming at the start and up higher if ya wanna cheat a bit.
Another power route to the right of True Grip... Good bouldery moves to the break and just enagaging enough to keep you focused all the way to the chains! Saddle Up!

Choss from top to bottom. The guide book claims this as 12d and one of the top 20 5.12s in maple. That's a bad joke. Harder than captain bullet. I had 5 holds blow off on me. There's a reason there is no chalk on this one.
content.location: One bolt line to the left of Captain Bullet. Has some obvious pockets through a roof.

content.description:
Twenty feet off the road, and enticingly steep, this handsome route begs to be climbed every time you drive by.

Make some pocket moves past two huge watermelon sized cobbles to the crux which involves a bomber kneebar, and some bad slopers.

Since this route is short, and it's very difficult to clip the last bolt, an attentive belay is required to keep a falling climber from hitting the ground.
content.protection: Quickdraws are required.  The anchors have carabiners.  A kneepad is useful, and a 50 meter rope will very easily get you back to the ground.
content.location: The obvious chalked up line next to the National Forest sign.  Since the river runs directly below this route, it might be difficult/impossible to climb this during the high water season.

content.description: A short and easy route that starts on the same platform as Gunsmoke and Jerry's Kids.
content.location: Up the small canyon, on the right side. It starts on the same platform at Gunsmoke and Jerry's Kids, just to the right of those two routes.

content.description: One of my favorite 10a's in Maple. Hidden in the back of a small canyon at the Frontera Crag, the wall is smooth sheared off cobbles. What makes this climb so unique is the spacing of the pockets on this climb, just far enough with little in between and the pockets are all almost the same size. For me, I love the flow of this route. Slightly overhanging, you can get a pump going. Not a bad 10a for your first lead of that level. I named it Gunsmoke to keep with The Frontera theme and the feeling of your guns a smoking near the chains. Even though this climb faces south it stays in the shade throughout the early morning and back in the shade again in the late afternoon.
content.location: This is in the small canyon between the two walls that are right next to the road at The Frontera Crag. In the back of this canyon is a smooth sheared wall that faces the road. This sheared wall has four climbs on it and faces south. Gunsmoke is the third climb from the left and the second from the right on this wall. The top of the wall has some maroon-colored rock.
